src: Rano Aroi... koia ko \textbf{tō{\ꞌ}ona} \textbf{ŋā{\ꞌ}atu}
trs: Rano Aroi with its bulrush’ \textstyleExampleref{[R112.051]}

src: {\ꞌ}Ina ō{\ꞌ}oku hora.
trs: I don’t have time.’ \textstyleExampleref{(\citealt[17]{MulloyRapu1977})}

src: {\ꞌ}i \textbf{te} \textbf{{\ꞌ}āva{\ꞌ}e} \textbf{era} \textbf{o} \textbf{{\ꞌ}Ātete}

src: Te pīkano nei {\ꞌ}i \textbf{te} \textbf{kona} \textbf{era} \textbf{o} \textbf{Roiho}.
trs: These eucalyptus trees are in that place (called) Roiho.’ \textstyleExampleref{[R130.008]}

imt: at \textsc{dist} stay \textsc{nmlz} \textsc{art} thing \textsc{med} \textsc{pred} cow \textsc{cntg} ten or \textsc{cntg} hundred  away at \textsc{poss.3sg.o} person \textsc{cntg} one
src: {\ꞌ}I rā noho iŋa te me{\ꞌ}e ena he pua{\ꞌ}a ka {\ꞌ}aŋahuru {\ꞌ}o ka hānere  atu i \textbf{tō{\ꞌ}ona} \textbf{kope} ka tahi.
trs: In that time each person (lit. his person one) had tens or hundreds of cows.’ \textstyleExampleref{[R107.035]}

imt: \textsc{num} on ten plus one manner different manner different manner different  \textsc{poss.3sg.o} book or \textsc{poss.3sg.o} story
src: E ho{\ꞌ}e {\ꞌ}ahuru mā ho{\ꞌ}e huru kē, huru kē, huru kē  \textbf{tō{\ꞌ}ona} \textbf{puka} {\ꞌ}o \textbf{tō{\ꞌ}ona} \textbf{{\ꞌ}a{\ꞌ}amu}.
trs: There are eleven different books and different stories.’ \textstyleExampleref{[R206.019]}

imt: \textsc{ntr} cry because\_of \textsc{art} die of Huri a Vai
src: He taŋi {\ꞌ}o te \textbf{mate} \textbf{o} \textbf{Huri} \textbf{{\ꞌ}a} \textbf{Vai}.
trs: He cried because of the death of Huri a Vai.’ \textstyleExampleref{[R304.104]}

imt: \textsc{num} two year remain for finish of \textsc{poss.1sg.o} learn
src: E rua matahiti toe mo oti o \textbf{tō{\ꞌ}oku} \textbf{hāpī}.
trs: There are two years left to finish my schooling.’ \textstyleExampleref{[R399.070]}

imt: at \textsc{art} day \textsc{dist} of \textsc{poss.3sg.o} bury \textsc{ntr} beautiful just
src: {\ꞌ}I te mahana era o \textbf{tō{\ꞌ}ona} \textbf{tanu,} he nehenehe nō.
trs: On the day of his funeral (‘his being buried’), it was beautiful.’ \textstyleExampleref{[R309.140]}

src: ...{\ꞌ}i \textbf{tō{\ꞌ}oku} \textbf{hiko} mai i te poki mai tu{\ꞌ}u hua{\ꞌ}ai.
trs: ...because I took (lit. in my taking) the child away from your family.’ \textstyleExampleref{[R229.027]}

imt: \textsc{prf} happy \textsc{cont} \textsc{prop} \textsc{1sg} at \textsc{art} time \textsc{prox} because\_of \textsc{poss.3sg.o} chase hither  \textsc{acc} \textsc{prop} \textsc{1sg}
src: Ko koa {\ꞌ}ā a au {\ꞌ}i te hora nei {\ꞌ}o \textbf{tō{\ꞌ}ona} \textbf{tute} mai  i a au.
trs: I am now happy because of his chasing me.’ \textstyleExampleref{[R214.053]}

src: He {\ꞌ}ui e tū tahutahu era i te tumu o \textbf{tō{\ꞌ}ona} \textbf{tere}.
trs: The witch asked about the reason for his trip.’ \textstyleExampleref{[R532-07.043]}

src: E hakaroŋo rivariva \textbf{tā{\ꞌ}aku} \textbf{hāpī}.
trs: Listen well to my teaching.’ \textstyleExampleref{[Luke 8:18]}

imt: \textsc{ntr} happy then \textsc{art} God at \textsc{art} sacrifice \textsc{dist} of\textsc{.a} Abel
src: He koa ia te {\ꞌ}Atua {\ꞌ}i te \textbf{tutia} era \textbf{{\ꞌ}a} \textbf{{\ꞌ}Avere}.
trs: God was happy with Abel’s sacrifice.’ \textstyleExampleref{[Gen. 4:4]}

imt: \textsc{ntr} become \textsc{pred} man good:\textsc{red} \textsc{ins} help of Eugenio
src: He riro he taŋata rivariva hai \textbf{{\ꞌ}aiua} \textbf{o} \textbf{Eugenio}.
trs: He became a good man with Eugenio’s help.’ \textstyleExampleref{[R231.316]}

src: \textbf{Tā{\ꞌ}ana} \textbf{{\ꞌ}aiua} he pua{\ꞌ}a e tahi.
trs: His help/contribution (for the feast) was a cow.’ \textstyleExampleref{[Notes]}

src: I oti era te \textbf{{\ꞌ}a{\ꞌ}amu} \textbf{{\ꞌ}a} \textbf{{\ꞌ}Orohe}...
trs: When Orohe’s story was finished...’ \textstyleExampleref{[R334.249]}

src: He katikati i \textbf{tā{\ꞌ}ana} \textbf{hīmene} a Kava.
trs: Kava sang his song.’ \textstyleExampleref{[R229.158]}

src: Nōatu \textbf{tō{\ꞌ}ona} \textbf{ture} mai.
trs: Don’t mind his scolding.’ \textstyleExampleref{[Egt-02.184]}

imt: \textsc{prf} manner different \textsc{cont} because\_of \textsc{poss.1sg.o} \textsc{conneg} answer \textsc{acc} \textsc{art}  word ask hither
src: Ko huru kē {\ꞌ}ā {\ꞌ}o \textbf{tō{\ꞌ}oku} \textbf{ta{\ꞌ}e} \textbf{pāhono} i te  vānaŋa {\ꞌ}ui mai.
trs: \is{Verb!nominalised}He feels strange because I didn’t answer (lit. my not answering) his question.’ \textstyleExampleref{[R363.108]}
